Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a RocketMQ consumer class that handles message consumption from a Logical Message Queue (LMQ) using POP mode, with proper initialization, message processing, and cleanup functionality.

Class Description: LMQPushPopConsumer is a Java class that demonstrates how to consume messages from a RocketMQ Logical Message Queue (LMQ) using POP (Pull-on-Poll) mode. It handles consumer initialization, topic subscription, message processing, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- CLUSTER_NAME: [String] - The name of the RocketMQ cluster
- BROKER_NAME: [String] - The name of the target broker
- TOPIC: [String] - The parent topic name
- LMQ_TOPIC: [String] - The Logical Message Queue topic name (prefixed with LMQ_PREFIX)
- NAMESRV_ADDR: [String] - The NameServer address
- CONSUMER_GROUP: [String] - The consumer group name
- BROKER_ADDR_MAP: [HashMap<Long, String>] - Mapping of broker IDs to their addresses
- consumer: [DefaultMQPushConsumer] - The RocketMQ push consumer instance
- mqAdminExt: [DefaultMQAdminExt] - The RocketMQ admin tool instance

Methods:
- initializeConsumer(): [void] -> [void] - Initializes the consumer by setting up POP mode, configuring consumer properties, subscribing to the topic, and registering a message listener
- switchPop(): [void] -> [void] - Configures the broker to use POP mode for message consumption
- shutdown(): [void] -> [void] - Shuts down the consumer and admin instances to release resources
